RelationshipElement.name: Old Bone Feature Associated Materials
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N relationship between Old Bone Features and Associated Materials

property.name: Grid Square
property.description: Letter code as marked in south-west corner of square

property.name: ID Number
property.description: Artefact identification code as marked on tag

property.name: Cluster
property.description: Description TBD

property.name: Cluster Type
property.description: Description TBD

lookup.term: {insitBO}2 or more in situ elements, a set of in situ articulated elements, or an in situ skeleton, not associated with any other in situ or surface material

{surfBO}Discrete cluster of bones of a similar type (part of same element or same skeleton, or in a similar state of preservation) on the surface, but in a topographic and sedimentary context indicating that they have not been transported
{insitAndSurf}2 or more in situ elements, a set of in situ articulated elements, or an in situ skeleton, plus a discrete surface cluster of bones of a similar type
{inistAndOth}In situ bone cluster as defined above, associated with other material, either in situ or on the surface
{surfAndOth}Surface bone cluster as defined above, associated with other material, either in situ or on the surface
{bothAndOth}In situ and surface bone cluster as defined above, associated with other material, either in situ or on the surface

property.name: Insitu Proportion
property.description: Select the proportion of visible bone that remains in situ:

lookup.term: mostThe majority of the visible bone is in situ
someAt least some of the bone is in situ
surfaceNo bone is embedded in sediment
recementThe bone appears to be in situ, but there is a high likelihood that it is actually cemented in redeposited sediment
ambiguousThe bone appears to be in situ, but it is impossible to say whether it is actually recemented

property.name: Body Parts Identifed
property.description: Select those of the following that have been observed, both in situ and on the surface

lookup.term: {cranNoTooth}Cranial elements (with or without maxilla) but no teeth
allpartsSome elements of each of cranial, limb and axial bones
otolfragFish otolith and other bone fragments
scuteBony plate (overlain with horn) from the shell of a turtle

property.name: Taxon Identified
property.description: Select those of the following that can be identified:

lookup.term: unidentThe taxon cannot be identified by the recorder
macropode.g. Western Grey, Eastern Grey, Red Kangaroo
otherbirdBird other than emu (swan, duck, etc)
undiagThe bone is undiagnostic of taxon

property.name: Bone Preservation
property.description: Select those types of modification that are common on the Good preservation visible bone:

lookup.term: weathpostSigns of post-exposure weathering and/or breakage
weathpreClear signs of weathering prior to burial
fragpostpost exposure fragmentation and splintering of bone
fragpreevidence of breakage prior to fossilisation
minstainflecks of manganese or other dark minerals
carbcarbonate encrustation on surface of bone

property.name: Deliberate Surface Modification
property.description: Select those types of deliberate modification that occur in any proportion on the visible bone:

property.name: Topographic Setting
property.description: Where on the lunette exposure is the old bone located?

lookup.term: rillfloorIn the floor of a deep rill (strong, vertical rilling in clay-rich sediments)
rillwallIn the wall of a deep rill (strong, vertical rilling in clay-rich sediments)
ridgeOn a narrow ridge in heavily eroded area
ridgerillFeature in a heavily eroded area is cut by deep rills and straddles rill wall and rill flow
shalgulflIn the floor of a gully less than 1.5m wide or deep
shalgulwalIn the wall of a gully less than 1.5m wide or deep
deepgulflIn the floor of a gully greater than 1.5m wide and deep
deepgulwalIn the wall of a gully greater than 1.5m wide and deep
residtopFlat surface on top of a residual
residsideIn the side of a residual
chanfloorIn the floor of a modern outwash channel
chanwallIn the wall of a modern outwash channel

property.name: Sediment Type
property.description: What are the sediments that encase the old bone, or upon which they are immediately lying?

lookup.term: redsandquartz sand of a reddish colour
brownsandquartz sands of a brownish colour
whitesandsand that is clean (no clay) and white
othersandquartz sands of a different colour (eg pink)
clayeysandquartz sands that contain some clay
laminarsandfine laminae of quartz sands, clayey sands and clays; brown colour, sands predominate
unconsolsandunconsolidated sands, sometimes with thin horizons of carbonate (archaeology bearing)
modernaeolianshifting veneer of unconsolidated sands, coppice sands
pelletalclaygrey clays made up of clay pellets
alternatalternating beds of pelletal clay and quartz sand
clay-altdistinct bed of pelletal clay within a sequence of alternating sands and clays
sand-altdistinct bed of quartz sand within a sequence of alternating sands and clays
bluelam-altmm-thick, but laterally traceable lens of clay with distinct ‘blue’ colour
darksoilsoil with greyish to dark greyish colour, carbonate rich
carbsoftsediment containing diffuse soil carbonate (C horizon)
carbnodulesediment containing hard carbonate nodules (C horizon)
carbpavemtwell developed in situ soil carbonates forming a solid pavement
carblagbroken up, angular pieces of carbonate nodules, root traces, burrows, rhizomorphs representing a reworked lag
finesiltfine, well-sorted silt with no clay component
cobblebeachcontinuous bed of rounded carbonate nodules, rhizomorphs etc together with rounded pebbles/cobbles of qtz or rock fragments
gravelbeachrelatively continuous bed of rounded gravels and coarse sand
Golgoldeeply weathered sands and clays with strong red colour
ggCGolgol C horizon: in situ carbonate nodules and sediments cemented together to form distinct pavement (pinkish colour)
gglagsurface lag made up of broken up, angular pieces of pinkish carbonate nodules, root traces etc derived from the Golgol C

property.name: Vulnerability To Erosion
property.description: Based on the cluster type and its topographic setting, how vulnerable is the old bone?

lookup.term: lowOn a relatively stable, flat surface or gentle slope that is not being eroded by rills, in well cemented (firm) sediment
moderateWider area is being eaten away by ongoing erosion, e.g. near edge of platform exposure, gully head, expanding rill system
highHigh probability of material being removed by erosion, or of the hearth losing its integrity, e.g. relatively steep slope with incipient rills and/or in loose sandy sediment
extremeHearth material is in imminent danger of rapid removal and loss, e.g. edge of eroding residual or deep rill, in gully wall, on a steep slope- washed surface, or in loose sandy sediment

property.name: Palaeotopographic Setting
property.description: Where is the old bone cluster located in relation to the original dune morphology?

lookup.term: foreduneStratigraphic layers are sloping towards the lakebed
backduneStratigraphic layers are sloping towards the hinterland
crestCrest of dune, stratigraphic layers slope away, towards both lakebed and hinterland
beachAn area of rounded cobbles or gravels in distinct horizon

property.name: Photos
property.description: Take 2 images: 1. landscape/stratigraphic setting (to aid re-location), include horizon and nearby landmarks that will have some longevity 2. the feature itself (to aid identification) – include the critical components of the feature like the in situ portion of a hearth or bone cluster

property.name: Notes
property.description: Any additional information worth noting that has not been covered by the recording

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Associated Materials
ArchaeologicalElement.description: A material associated with a feature cluster

property.name: Associated in situ material
property.description: If material other than old bone is associated, select those of the following that have been observed in situ

property.name: Associated surface material
property.description: If material other than old bone is associated, select those of the following that have been observed on the surface

lookup.term: fragmajority of shell is highly fragmented
modfragmixture of fragmented and near whole shell
wholemajority of shell is whole or near whole

property.name: Associated Hearth Material
property.description: If hearthstone material is associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed:

lookup.term: clayBaked clay or sandy clay hearthstones
termTermite nest hearthstones (holes and channels visible)
otherHearthstones of other material, e.g. stone

property.name: Associated Eggshell
property.description: If eggshell is associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed:

lookup.term: otherOther eggshell, clearly not emu or Genyornis
indetIndeterminate eggshell, features unclear due to surface modification

property.name: Associated Stone Artefacts
property.description: If stone artefacts are associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed

property.name: Associated Chipped Stone Artefacts
property.description: If chipped stone is present, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed:

lookup.term: debFlaking debris, including whole flakes, broken flakes and angular fragments
otherruAny other type of retouch or use-wear

property.name: Associated Unmodified Stone
property.description: If unmodified stone is associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed:

lookup.term: pebbleSmall nodular or rounded piece, unlikely to be useful for artefact manufacture

property.name: Ground Stone Types Present
property.description: If ground stone is associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed:

lookup.term: millstoneLarge, concave to flattish ground surface
mullerConvex surface with facet from back and forth motion
pestleA cobble with convex or flattish ground end
amorphPoorly defined, or small, discontinuous ground surface, not matching any of the above
undiagFragmentary, not complete enough to distinguish nature of ground surface

property.name: Ground Stone Status
property.description: If ground stone is associated, either in situ or on the surface, is the ground material...:

property.name: Raw Material Types Present
property.description: If stone artefacts are associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those types of raw material that have been observed:

property.name: Associated Other Artefacts
property.description: If other worked or transported material is associated, either in situ or on the surface, select those of the following that have been observed:

lookup.term: bonemodbone with ground or polished surface(s), may be bevelled or pointed at one or both ends
shellmodshell with notches or other evidence of working or use along one or more margins
ochredissflecks or fragments of ochre disseminated through the sediment
ochrefacetochre with facets, indicating use as crayon

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Photolog
ArchaeologicalElement.description: A record of images created and stored on another device, eg by a professional site photographer.

property.name: Photo ID
property.description: Unique number or code allocated by creator of the image. It could be a filename or a reference number

property.name: Photo Timestamp
property.description: Time at which the photo was taken

property.name: Photo Note
property.description: Description TBD

property.name: Photos Taken
property.description: What type of photos have been or will be taken?

lookup.term: generalOnly general artefact and setting photos taken
bothBoth frame and general photos taken
